definition[0]: the amount of goods or passengers that can be carried by a vehicle, or the goods that a vehicle is carrying
example[0]: The helicopter is designed to carry a payload of 2,640 pounds.
definition[1]: the amount of explosive that a missile can carry
definition[2]: the amount of goods or passengers that are carried by a vehicle or aircraft, measured by their weight, and for which payment is received
example[1]: The Federal Express freighters will carry agross payload of 187,500 pounds.
